info.title: Adding VLANS over a network teaming device

abstract.para: VLANs allow the running of multiple logical (virtual) Ethernets over one single physical Ethernet. They logically split the network into different broadcast domains so that packets are only switched between ports that are designated for the same VLAN.

topic.para: The following procedure creates two static VLANs on top of a team device:

listitem.para: VLAN tags are enabled on the switch. To use load balancing for the team device, the switch needs to be capable of Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP) (802.3ad). Consult your hardware manual for details.
A networking teaming device is already configured as described in .

procedure.title: Adding VLANs over a network teaming device

step.para: In /etc/sysconfig/network, create a file named ifcfg-vlan0 and add the following content:
step.screen: STARTMODE="auto" BOOTPROTO="static" IPADDR='&subnetI;0.1/24' ETHERDEVICE="team0" VLAN_ID="0" VLAN='yes'

callout.para: Specifies that the IP address is fixed.
Defines the IP address and netmask.
Contains the real interface to use for the VLAN interface. This example uses the team device team0.
Specifies a unique ID for the VLAN. Preferably, the file name and the VLAN_ID corresponds to the name ifcfg-vlanVLAN_ID. In this example VLAN_ID is 0, which leads to the file name ifcfg-vlan0.

step.para: Copy the file /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-vlan0 to /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-vlan1 and change the following values:
